metadata.dc:title: Adaptation and validaton of the Emotional Intelligence Inventory (EII): a pilot study
metadata.dc:description: This study examines the adaptation and validation of the emotional intelligence questionnaire, Emotional Intelligence Inventory (EII) to the Spanish school population, including its traslation, transcultural adaptation and the study of its psychomeric properties (reliability, criteria validity with depression and concuretn validity). The EII was deeloped by Tapia (2001), originally in English, to measure the dimensions of emotional intelignce based upon Salovey and Mayer´s model (1990): empathy, tilization of feelings, hadling relationships and self conro. Results show an adequate relability of the EII, and its subscales; in addition, edence suggests that, in general, high scores on the emotional intelligence questionnaire (EII) predict a lower rate of depressive symptomatoogy; finall, a significant relationship was found with other motional intelligence intruments, (TMMS)(AU)
